p: Paradoxically, elevated IFNs correlate with worse disease. In a cohort of clinically well-described SARS patients, high levels of IFN-α and ISGs correlated with disease severity ( Cameron et al., 2007). In patients who developed severe hypoxemia, high levels of IFN-induced chemokines and IFNAR1 persisted even after the resolution of acute illness. Similarly, IFN-α levels were more frequently elevated in the severe MERS patient group than in the mild group, and correlated with viral RNA copies ( Kim et al., 2016). In a small COVID-19 patient cohort, levels of IFN-α and ISGs were associated with viral load as well as disease severity ( Wei et al., 2020). These studies indicate that severe infections lead to high IFN signatures but fail to bring down viral load.
